description: From Middle English froren, past participle of fresen (“to freeze”), from Old English frēosan.

adjectives.description: frore (comparative more frore, superlative most frore)

examples: We die, even as the winds of Autumn fade,
Expiring in the frore and foggy air.

entries.meaning: (archaic, rare) simple past tense and past participle of freeze
examples: And down below all fretted and frore,Were wrought the coral and the madrepore,  […]
